I've decided to post the manuscript for a fairly comprehensive journal
arti=
cle on HyperNEAT that will be coming out in 2009 in Arficial Life
journal (=
Artificial Life journal has a long backup of articles).  One
reason for the=
 timing is that I will be giving a keynote talk about
HyperNEAT at the Inte=
rnational Conference on Neural Networks (ICANN)
in Prague next week, and I =
felt it would be good to have this more
comprehensive reference available f=
or that.  If you happen to be going
to ICANN, I will be giving the talk on =
the last day at 9-10am.

The article is a detailed synthesis of the work of=
 David D'Ambrosio,
Jason Gauci, and myself from 2007.  However, it goes int=
o greater
depth and includes a lot more HyperNEAT pattern visualization and=

analysis than the conference papers.  People in this group interested
in H=
yperNEAT may in particular find the visualizations intuitively
interesting.=
  

The 39-page paper is called, "A Hypercube-Based Indirect Encoding for
E=
volving Large-Scale Neural Networks," and is available here:

http://eplex.=
cs.ucf.edu/publications.html#stanley.alife09

ken
